page.title: 11HISTORIC CRESSBROOK MILL
page.content: {Cressbrook Mill}at the confluence of the rivers Wye and Cressbrook is a Grade 2 listed building, built for {Sir Richard Arkwright}in the late 1700's,for use as a cotton spinning factory.In 1965 it fell into disrepair It was purchased by the present owners in 1973 for Â£21,000.The whole property comprises:the large four storied listed building,which has an imposing Georgian facade,and several other large 2 or 3 storied factory type buildings around yards with a mill- race running through the centre of the property. The listed building is virtually derelict. Some of the buildings have been converted for use as; a dwelling for the present owners, a squash court,a stone-cutting factory,and some for storing cut stone.
